intro: Lapeirousia fastigiata, commonly known as the pink-flowered clump-forming bulbous plant, is a species native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and produces showy, pink to purple flowers during the summer months. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
